data.title: Miners Village
data.statement: In Miners Village [[m]] miners in [[t]] hours of time produces [[a]] amount of stones (stones cannot be partially produced, so [[a]] is always a whole number). Each miner works on individual stones. How many stones are [[n]] miners producing during [[u]] hours of time? If the number of stones produced by a miner in [[n]] hours is not a whole number, round the stone number for each miners down before summarizing.
data.stubGenerator:
read m:int t:int a:int
read n:int u:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> 3 space separated integers [[m]], [[t]] and [[a]] for the reference number of miners, the necessary duration in hours and the produced number of whole stones respectively.
<<Line 2:>> 2 space separated integers [[n]] and [[u]] for the actual number of miners and the actual duration in hours respectively.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1 :>> An integer, given the summary of the whole stones [[n]] miners are producing during [[u]] hours.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In Miners Village m miners in t hours of time produces a amount of stones (stones cannot be partially produced, so a is always a whole number). Each miner works on individual stones. How many stones are n miners producing during u hours of time? If the number of stones produced by a miner in n hours is not a whole number, round the stone number for each miners down before summarizing.
Input
Line 1: 3 space separated integers m, t and a for the reference number of miners, the necessary duration in hours and the produced number of whole stones respectively.
Line 2: 2 space separated integers n and u for the actual number of miners and the actual duration in hours respectively.
Output
Line 1 : An integer, given the summary of the whole stones n miners are producing during u hours.
Constraints
1 ≤ m ≤ 100, m <= a
1 ≤ t ≤ 100
1 ≤ a ≤ 100
1 ≤ n ≤ 100
1 ≤ u ≤ 100
Example
Input
9 9 9
1 9
Output
1
